subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Floyd Mayweather Jr. is again saying that he will take an extended break from boxing, insisting he is “bored with the sport” after he stopped Ricky Hatton in the 10th round of their 147-pound title fight in Las Vegas on Saturday night. The end came after Mayweather landed a crushing left hook that dropped Hatton on his back. Hatton got up at the count of eight, but Mayweather (39-0) almost immediately put him on the ropes and landed another flurry of punches to the head.Hatton went down while the referee Joe Cortez moved in to stop the fight, and Hatton’s corner threw in the towel.“He was definitely the toughest competitor I’ve ever faced,” said Mayweather, who was ahead by 89-81 on two ringside scorecards and by 88-82 on the other when the fight was stopped.
